metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage RSS feeds for published posts

steps.action: Navigate to the News page containing the Publisher module
steps.expected: Publisher module should be displayed with posts and sharing options
steps.actual: Publisher module displayed with 6 published posts, Tags, Authors sidebar, and social sharing icons including RSS feed link

steps.action: Click on the RSS feed link or navigate to the RSS URL directly
steps.expected: RSS feed should be generated as XML content
steps.actual: RSS feed generated successfully at http://localhost:8081/en-us/News/view/rss with valid RSS 2.0 XML format

steps.action: Examine the RSS feed output for proper XML structure
steps.expected: RSS feed should contain valid RSS 2.0 XML with proper elements (channel, item, title, link, description, pubDate)
steps.actual: RSS feed contains valid RSS 2.0 XML: XML declaration (version 1.0, UTF-8), rss element with Atom namespace, channel element with link and language (en-US), multiple item elements each containing link, author, title, description (HTML-encoded), pubDate, and category elements where applicable

steps.action: Examine the RSS feed metadata in the channel element
steps.expected: Feed should include proper metadata like channel link, language
steps.actual: Feed includes channel link (http://localhost:8081/en-us/News), language (en-US), and each item includes author name (SuperUser Account), publication date, and categories/tags

observations: RSS feed is enabled by default in the Publisher module settings (5 sharing checkboxes visible: Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, RSS)
Feed contains all published posts from the module, showing 5-6 items in the feed
Feed item limits are controlled by the Publisher_RssMaxPosts portal setting (default 20 based on code review)
The RSS icon appears in the social share section alongside other sharing options (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest)
Post descriptions in the feed contain HTML-encoded content preserving formatting
